title: Does Creed frontman sound a little like Vedder from Pearl Jam? (Pearl Jam fans: Take it easy, I'm not comparing or branding their sounds as identical, I just wanted to know if Creed is a little inspired by early Pearl Jam.) - Quora

response.answer_text: Yeah, Scott Stapp sounds similar to Eddie Vedder albeit less interesting. I figure however, that Creed’s music and the production values of their albums are more along the lines of Load-era Metallica or something similar. Couple those with Scott Stapp’s bombastic Bono-like persona and you have a perfect storm of late nineties middle american popular appeal and highbrow critical resentment. Interestingly enough, as Pearl Jam is essentially Temple of the Dog with Eddie Vedder replacing Chris Cornell as the lead singer. Alter Bridge is Creed with Myles Kennedy replacing Scott Stapp as the lead singer. Cornell and Kennedy too are somewhat similar vocalists but Alter Bridge and Temple of the Dog sound almost nothing alike. I’m not a Creed fan but from what I’ve heard Alter Bridge is actually pretty good.
The kind of similarity that you are talking about is because of the fact that both the singers are Baritone singers. So are Chris Cornell of Soundgarden and Aaron Lewis from Staind.
